column1: Big data is a term for data sets that are so large or complex that traditional data processing applications are inadequate. Challenges include analysis
column10: updating and information privacy. The term often refers simply to the use of predictive analytics
column12: or certain other advanced data analytics methods that extract value from data
column13: and seldom to a particular size of data set. Accuracy in big data may lead to more confident decision making
column14: and better decisions can result in greater operational efficiency
column15: cost reduction and reduced risk.Analysis of data sets can find new correlations to "spot business trends
column17: combat crime and so on." Scientists
column20: advertising and governments alike regularly meet difficulties with large data sets in areas including Internet search
